level.heading: Claims to an instrument.
level.text: A person taking an instrument, other than a person having rights of a holder in due course, is subject to a claim of a property or possessory right in the instrument or its proceeds, including a claim to rescind a negotiation and to recover the instrument or its proceeds. A person having rights of a holder in due course takes free of the claim to the instrument.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 28:3-302, § 28:3-305, and § 28:3-602.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-249
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-249, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 28:3-101.
